resources.string: Select unit \"m\" or \"ft\", leave distance \"0\" if you don\'t need a projection:
Enter formulas with x, y being unknown, e.g. "12.(3+x)4y" or import from clipboard.
Could not solve formulas. Please check them for errors.
No implementation found for export to format
Failed sending the waypoints to another app for displaying them.
Sorry, the calculation did not result in any valid coordinates.
Some x or y that did not result in valid coordinates have been omitted.
Please limit the value ranges to a maximum of 100 points.

Currently Coordinate Joker is configured for use with Locus Map.

Time for a short intro …

Currently Coordinate Joker is not configured for use with Locus Map, so we describe use with c:geo as another app example. Expert settings offer a variety of further scenarios.

Time for a short intro …
On the main screen enter the coordinate formulas with x, y being the unknown variables. Define which x and y values shall be tried, then hit the \'Show\'-button for displaying the points.
If Coordinate Joker is configured for use with c:geo but does not find it, you will need to select an alternative app manually when Android asks you.
Locus will ask you where to import the waypoints. Best create an own folder like \'joker\'. Thus you can easily hide or clear all points at once instead of doing it for each point individually.

If you use c:geo you will be asked where to import the waypoints. Best create an own folder like \'joker\'. Thus you can easily hide or clear all points at once instead of doing it for each point individually.

Locus will show the points on the map, so you may determine, which are worth a visit.

Good luck!

You can then display the points on the map, so you may determine, which are worth a visit.

Good luck!
Negative numbers are not supported in the value range definition.
\'From\' must be smaller than \'to\' in the value range definition.
Negative step sizes are not supported in the value range definition.
Please fix the value range definition.
Enter range like \"1-5#2,7-9,20\" (\"#2\" means step size 2) or leave empty:

Adjust the input to match the following format: N …° …\' E …° …\' …m …° TN (or ft instead of m, you may omit the projection part). You may use linebreaks instead of °, \'. Finally replace the unknown variables by x (and y).
Automatic variable replacement by x, y did not succeed. Please adjust them manually above.
The clipboard contained too much data to be processed. Please copy just the formula to the clipboard.
Pasting from the clipboard did not succeed. You may try to insert it here manually.
The input could not be analysed.
